Review.Titre: Another worthless company that asks customers to do the bosses job.
Review.Contenu: I inquired to New Air about a replacement hose for their Air Conditioner. It is a non-standard size, 5.9 inches in diameter. They took 3 days to answer and then wanted $19.95 for the hose. The AC only cost $150.00. So I asked for a quote with shipping to Montana. That added another $20.00! The total would be about 1/3 of what the entire AC cost. I declined. Then they sent me a request to review their employee who gave me the quote. Seriously? They wanted me to evaluate their employee! So I was honest and submitted a review. I said the employee was fine but the company sucked. I told them that if I was their employee I would quit and find a company that trusted my abilities and did not ask customers to do the boss's job. So next I get an obviously automated response profusely thanking me for my employee review and requesting that I place a review on FaceBook, Google, or Trust Pilot. Facebook and Google have their own trust issues. They spy on users and sell private user data to the highest bidder. Why should anyone trust them? So I chose Trust Pilot and left an honest review. New Air sucks and I will never buy any of their products.

I bought a Newair Nugget Ice Maker in July 2022, in October I started to see brown streaks coming from the top of the machine into the water reservoir. I didn’t pay a shipping charge when I ordered the first one on Amazon Prime so this was not much of an incentive.  As it stands now, I have to clean the machine 3 times each week to try to make sure that whatever the brown substance is, that it won’t poison my family.  This is awful customer service in my opinion.  All I wanted was a replacement on a machine that literally costs Newair a fraction of what I paid for it! Do your own due diligence and do not solely trust Newair reviews on Google and Trustpilot as they are, in my opinion, not a reflection of the actual products offered by company or the after sale service. The only reflection here is that majority of these consumers had an issue with their product and they were promised/given a replacement. Hence that’s why you see so many shout outs to the customer service agents who advised them to leave the reviews. In my experience, the name of the game was bait & switch.I purchased a Newair 840 cigar humidor remanufactured by Newair in July 2022. Unit arrived two months later, physically and functionally damaged. I was promised a replacement in lieu of posting reviews on Google and Trustpilot which I did. The very next day, I was informed the unit was out of stock. Even though I was disappointed, I figured I could wait a little longer for a replacement as I really liked the unit.Fast forward to August 2023, skipping out some “are we there yet” communications, I asked for a replacement to be processed and also asked how I could communicate with the senior leadership of the company regarding my disappointing experience. I was never offered a way to communicate with anyone in senior leadership but I was offered a replacement once again! This time instead of reviews, I just needed to cut the power cord to the unit to prepare to discard and take some picture to send back to Newair while I wait for my replacement unit. To my not so surprise, I was informed the next day the unit could not be replaced because it was remanufactured like they didn’t know all along. I was never offered a way to communicate with someone else and received an email stating a refund was processed after filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.I’m especially disappointed that Newair could not stand behind their word, twice. If you promise something, it’s your responsibility to follow thorough. If it’s your incompetent customer service’s mistake, then you own up to that and honor what they promise as the representatives of your brand name!I loved the unique look and functions of the Newair 840. The company has some innovative and fun products that are out of norm in small appliances. I could have purchased their 1500 humidor model or a nice beverage cooler in the future but there are brands who I know will stand behind their products with confidence. Newair’s incompetent customer service is enough for me to look elsewhere in the future.

I purchased a beverage cooler and very quickly the temperature sensor wasn't working. They have sent me several replacement sensors at no cost, but clearly there is something wrong with their sensors. They should be fixing the sensors instead of just sending new ones over and over. Their customer service has been friendly and responsive, but overall, i am frustrated with my experience with them.

Atrocious customer service a day agoI purchased a new air beverage refrigerator two years ago. The blue colored lightbulbs burnt out so Icontacted New Air to purchase new lightbulbs for the beverage refrigerator.  One of the specific reasons I purchased this particular beverage refrigerator was because it illuminated a blue color and looked really cool. For two months I have reached out six different times via emails(5) and phone calls (6) regarding this beverage refrigerator with model number, SKU number, and photographs to get new light bulbs.  Two separate times I received the incorrect lightbulbs. Each time I was told they would follow up and call me back regarding the correct lightbulb request and never received a follow up whatsoever. I’m going on two months now dealing with this and have decided that I will never get anywhere with this company. All I wanted were simple lightbulbs and I can’t recieve adequate customer service.  I can imagine if I had a serious issue with the beverage refrigerator. They can’t even handle a simple request .Profile imageKim ShumateUpdate… I received a reply from New Air last night, requesting that I call them today and they will take care of the issue. I phoned them twice today and not surprisingly DID NOT receive a phone call back from customer service. I guess I was hoping that they would rectify my tiny request for lightbulbs for my beverage refrigerator. How disappointing. I give up I have never had such horrendous customer service ever for anything.Update regarding customer service. After receiving a letter from New Air, they proceeded to send me the same incorrect lightbulbs for the third time. They seem to have a difficult time finding the correct lightbulbs, even though I sent them photos of the correct lightbulbs that I need but receiving the incorrect lightbulbs three times. I am now sitting with six incorrect lightbulbs for my new air fridge and they can’t seem to get my simple request correct. At this point it is comical, I will keep you updated because now I’m curious to see if they’ll ever get it right.  The definition of stupid is doing the same thing over and over without changing. Let’s see what happens. I sent them a photo of the lightbulb that I need and I don’t understand why it is so hard to fulfill that request. Follow up, I made two phone calls today to the customer service that they asked me to call. I thought they would rectify the problem but they never returned both of my phone calls. I guess I’m not that disappointed since the original customer service was horrible.  Beware of any issues you may have with their products.  All I wanted was two little lightbulbs for the beverage refrigerator, it wasn’t even a serious issue with the product itself. What does that tell you. Beware.UpdateOne month later…… still waiting for A Follow up…… NOTHING 😬ANOTHER ATROCIOUS UPDATE…I received a 3rd attempted lightbulb replacement request… THIS IS MY 3rd incorrect order delivered….this is now comical.

I requested a new unit or a certified technician to repair it. What I got was an offer of 40% off a new unit!. The company knows that this unit has a faulty fuse issue and sells it anyway. Review.Titre: Remanufactured means send the problem to a new customer
Review.Contenu: Purchased a remanufactured mister fan for my patio and a two year warranty. Upon receiving the unit I discovered that the plastic gears that provide the oscillating function were bad. A poor design that was obviously never remanufactured. When I contacted customer service they informed me that there was no more stock and that I could only return it for a refund. After sending it back and several more calls I got a partial refund after 3 weeks.  They informed me upon my inquiry of why it was only a partial refund that they do not refund shipping costs. So it cost me ~ $35 and a month of my time to receive and return a defective unit. Don’t buy anything remanufactured by them and especially don’t buy a mister fan, even new, as it is poorly designed. Absolutely an awful experience with New Air!!!

Review.Titre: Newair is crap they would only send…
Review.Contenu: Newair is crap they would only send part under warranty if I left a review. Fixed with new part and it broke agai 3 mos later....Just crap

Review.Titre: NewAir Customer Support will say anything to not honor a warranty
Review.Contenu: On 12/18/21 I purchased NewAir NCH840BK00 cigar humidor. From the day it was first plugged in the compressor was extremely noisy loud banging sound that fills the room and runs constantly. Over the past few months the banging has gotten louder and can be heard in other parts of the house. The humidification is set at 70% humidity, however, the cigars have never felt right. I purchased a hygrometer calibration kit. After placing the calibrated hygrometer in the humidor for 48 hours it read 59% not the 70% it is set at. Since the unit is still under warranty, I contacted Customer Support I was asked to send a recording of the sound which I did. I was told the "noise is normal & is coming from the expansion valve." I was also told I had to "set 3 hygrometers in the unit to accurately measure the humidity." I have owned other NewAir humidors and have never heard of such ridiculous statements. NewAir clearly will say anything to get out of honoring the warranty they say exists.

Review.Titre: ordered a wine frig from New - Air
Review.Contenu: ordered a wine frig. never received delivery  confirmation as they said I would. Delivery company left 120 pound wine frig. outside in a uncovered area. I was home all day,Delivery person never rang door bell to notify of delivery. Box was left below steps , in uncovered area completely exposed to the elements. top of box was not sealed , visual structural damage to box on the side. called company as on hold for 20 minutes finally got a rep who indicated he would send a return label, I have yet to receive the return label. Was told to leave box there and fed ex would pick up in the morning.Box is outside in the elements  still after several hours have not received return shipping label.   NewAir has been a complete headache to do business with, save yourself the aggravation and order from another vendor. I will update when i receive a return delivery and credit.

Bought a NewAir dual zone beverage cooler in late 2018. In March 2021, I noticed the temperature reading was stuck at 99 degrees Fahrenheit in the left side cooler and everything on the left side was frozen. Tried unplugging, defrosting, cleaning out the spills from the exploded cans, and resetting the temperature to 48 degrees. The temperature reading is showing the set temperature, but everything is frozen again.  Customer service agreed that it’s a faulty temperature sensor, which seems to be a common issue with their products. However, I can’t simply order the part on their website. I need to call and give my credit card info over the phone - to a company I have zero faith in. I’ve offered several alternatives and currently waiting to hear if they’ll accept a MasterCard gift card (it’s not sounding promising). What a scam. STAY FAR, FAR AWAY FROM THIS MANUFACTURER!!!Updated: they do not accept gift cards. So buy their crappy products so they can steal your credit card number when you’re forced to buy replacement parts.

I ordered a handle from NewAir and placed the order.  I received an email telling me it was shipped.  I never received a tracking number.  After 4 days, I emailed customer service and was told they would get me one from the shipping department.  That never happened.  When I inquired after a week of not getting my item, I was told that it was about to ship that day.  Then I find out later it was not in stock and they were trying to get it.  There was no communication that this was the case.  No email, nothing.  They sure didn't care to pull the money out of my account.  But couldn't be courteous enough to send me an email or let me know what was going on with my order.  I finally spoke to someone by phone (Afernee) who was very matter of fact and really offered nothing to fix my issue or make it right.  They said they were trying to get an approval to remove the handle from another item and ship it to me but could not promise anything.  I finally cancelled my order as this company obviously does not have it together.  Horrible customer service.  I will not do business here again.

Review.Titre: Excellent Customer Service experience with Newair
Review.Contenu: Updated review: 9/22/2022Originally I gave this company a 5-star review but now I am revising it.  We have been waiting on a single replacement part to repair our less than 4-year-old beverage cooler.  It has been approx 6 months of us regularly reaching out for an update - and always the same basic answer just with a different date -"we are expecting a container in (insert a month)".  When that month arrives we are given another date -  so on and so forth.  Needless to say, we have a fairly new appliance that has not worked for 6 months.  The company was so "kind" as to offer us a small discount on purchasing a new unit from them.  Why would we buy another one of your products when we already have a fairly new one that doesn't work and apparently will never be repaired?  VERY DISAPPOINTED - we will not be purchasing your products in the future.Original review date 4/27/2022We are having some temperature issues with our Newair wine/beverage cooler.  I reached out via email to their customer support team and much to my surprise they have been very responsive.  In today's environment, good customer service (especially on a previously purchased product) is hard to find.  They have answered questions, and given troubleshooting tips and solutions.  Thanks for being so responsive.

Ordered what looked like an awesome beverage refrigerator for my garage. It was priced fairly and the unit had high reviews.I received the unit on 7/24/19. When I opened the package, the glass on the door was broken on the inner side, Completely shattered. I reached out to NEWAIR the following day and was told that a replacement door would be sent to make the repair. I received the email confirmation that the damage had been noted and a door would be sent in 3 to 5 business days.Fast forward 10 days and no door. I called and was told that the Door would again be sent in 3 to 5 business days and I should receive another email with tracking information. No email ever arrived nd no tracking information. I wait 4 days and call back, I am told that they don't know why the door wasn't shipped, they had 3 in stock. Frustrated I asked for a refund as I am tired of dealing with this at this point.Now I get to go home to recreate a box because I threw the other out. Thinking I was going to receive a replacement door. Package everything so as not to allow any further damage to the unit and wait for a FEDEX label do I can send it back to them.Then and Only then, can my refund be processed, again in 5-7 business days AFTER they receive the defective unit?We shall see if they hold to their word on my refund.I would not recommend this company or their products due to the extremely poor service they provide. Be very careful about giving them yoiur hard earned money.

Completely bizarre experience. TL;DR: Please don't order from these folks, it's just not worth it. If you do, you may end up in a bizarro-world time suck talking to really inept customer service reps. I ordered a fridge from these folks, direct from their website. Site said order should ship within 2 days for the item I purchased. After around a week, I still hadn't received tracking info, so I reached out to their customer service team. I spoke with 4 different CSRs over the course of a few days and phone calls, each read the same canned response off their sheet and said that tracking info is commonly delayed in populating and I'd receive info in the next 24 hrs. Nothing. After 3 more days, I finally opted to cancel my order and move on with my life. Refund received, that should have been the end of it. Then 2 weeks after receiving my refund (almost 4 weeks after date of order), my fridge was delivered even though I'd been refunded already. I kept telling myself to just sell it on craigslist, but my conscience won out...decided it wasn't worth bad karma over a fridge I no longer need. So I call customer service over in Asia again, get put on hold for a while, only to frustrate "Liz," a CSR, and get hung up on. Call back again, speak with "Bev," a manager, and she is now attempting to coordinate pickup of this thing. I really doubt this saga is over, this company is so terrible. If it's still in my garage come xmas, I'm donating it to someone in need.

8/19 Update: Since my last initial post, this experience has become a veritable nightmare:-After being told the part would be shipped out, I never received tracking info and part did not ship-I had to follow up multiple times to get the part shipped-Part showed up and it was the incorrect part-Sent photos of incorrect and correct part I needed-Another part was sent out-Still the wrong part-Repeated this exercise with another agent-Received wrong part for 3rd time-For the next month, I continually followed up and asked to speak to a manager.  Managers are never available and never called me back.-Finally they determined that they had the correct SKU but that the warehouse somehow keeps shipping the wrong part.  In order for the correct part of be sent, someone at New Air would need to make contact with them and sort this out.-Weeks go by, no update-Never once do they proactively update me.  I always have to follow up.   And I always have to deal with a new person every time I call who is not familiar with the case.  It seems like I am starting from scratch each time-In an act of desperation, I speak with a rep and threaten to email the CEO every day until they fix the issue-Miraculously, the rep makes contact with a manager who indicates that they have finally made contact with the factory and resolved the issue.  New part will be shipped out imminently.-I receive an order confirmation for the new part, but no tracking information.  It says it is going out fedex 2 day air-5 days later, it has not been received-Called and spoke with a rep.  Their system also does not have a tracking #.  She will need to research and will email me an upate.-The saga continues...stay tuned for the final outcome....I'll post my next update in two months when this is still an issue.In the mean time, I can't put my wine fridge against the wall because I broke the drip tray during a defrost because the wine fridge never actually worked right from the start.  Two of the shelves freeze over and the temperature never reaches the desired state.  They said the temperature gauge must be off and sent me a new one to install which requires me to remove every single shelf from the unit.   One of these days I'll get around to that.  In the mean time I am limited to a 50 degree low temp and risk two shelves getting iced to the back every so often.  Will NEVER buy another New Air product so long as I live.  They actually coerced me into writing 3 positive reviews for them by offering free shipping on the part.  So shady.

Review.Titre: double charged, won't refund till shipment returned and lied about shipping
Review.Contenu: Place an order online for a wine cooler on 4/14. The total amount was $2289.69 and the website charged my card. A couple of hour later I received an e-mail from Newair stating that there was additional security measures needed to approve my order and for me to contact them. I call the number on the e-mail and spoke to a Camilla Mendez. She said I needed to send her a copy of my drivers license to approve the order. I was not comfortable sending a copy of my drivers license so I asked her if she can just verify me over the phone. She said she can, but it would be a new order. So I told her that's fine as long as the previous order is canceled and I don't get double charged. She said it is only a hold on the card and if I don't supply my drivers license, the order will get canceled in 48hours. I informed her that I am on my creditcard's website and the charges shows posted and not a hold. she assured me that it was a hold and will be released in 48hours. I checked my account on 4/18 and 2 charges shows up under Newair. I contacted Newair immediately and the customer rep, Fern, told me that both shipment has shipped and they can't refund me until the duplicate shipment gets refused and return to their warehouse. I requested that they contact the shipping company and just cancel the shipment so they can ship it back, but Fern said they contacted the shipping company and they could not do a reroute of the shipment, it had to be refused and sent back. I checked the tracking number for both shipments on 4/21 and both show that it has been at the terminal since 4/15. I called the shipping company to get an update and they said they have been trying to schedule a delivery with me for a week, The BOL had Newair number on it instead of mine and no one at Newair return their call. I explain that I am the consignee and I like to schedule the shipment. I also inquired about the duplicate shipment. The shipping company said according to their notes no one had called contacted them regarding the duplicate shipment and all it takes is a call to them and they would route it back. Because it does not make any sense for them to try and deliver it and have it refused when it is already confirmed to be a cancel shipment. So Newair charged me twice even when they assured me it was a hold, then they lied about the shipping also. Most likely to charge me a restocking fee or some other hidden fees that they are trying to hide. I also never received the free wine tumbler set that was advertised on their website as a free gift with purchase.
Bought two wine coolers, both broke.

Sent back unit since it was under warranty.  Customer service did not follow through on providing return dates. Had to email a copy of the receipt to prove that it was indeed within the 1-year warranty period.  Finally, Newair decided to send a replacement unit.  Far too difficult to work with.

Review.Titre: Temp sensor is a hi fail item - expect problems.
Review.Contenu: Purchased NewAir dual zone beverage cooler model AWB-360DB in Feb of 2018 for about $700. In April of 2019 the right side temp sensor failed. Internet research indicates this is a high fail item, has been for quite some time. In fact, such a high failure rate they were out of stock. The part was $21 plus shipping, about $25 total.  With it I lost three bottles of wine so the total cost of the failure and repair was over $100. Today, September 6, 2019, the left side failed but this time I only froze and burst a few soda cans. Part cost was again $21 and in stock this time.  Point is, for a $700 cooler I expect the parts to last longer.  With such a failure rate, why hasn't NewAir engineered something more reliable and offered it to the customers? I feel it is because the temp sensor is proprietary equipment, meaning only they make it and sell it to make money. I looked at my first bad sensor and it did not have any markings, no indication of voltage required or sensor details. NewAir has customers captive, if they want a working cooler they must buy from NewAir, so why improve it and lose out on making money?  At least I can replace it myself  and not pay a technician. If I had a choice I would return this cooler for a refund however the first failure happened just after the one year warranty expired.

Review.Titre: Newair isn't a 5 star company based on…
Review.Contenu: Newair isn't a 5 star company based on there customer service manager not excepting responsibility for the mistake his employees made costing me lots of money due to the cigars I lost and couldnt save and some were cubans based on the info I was given by newair. After calling them and asking them about the newair cc100h humidor and getting all the info not one time days prior to ordering it did they say it was out of stock. So I ordered a lot of expensive cigars to find out the humidor was out of stock until the end of august I talked to the person in customer service 3 days in a row they told me the same thing it was out of stock until the end of august I knew I was in trouble I had cigars coming and they was delivered by ups that day right around a 100 cigars I spent the day trying to find a safe way to store them needless to say I was upset so another day and a half went by so out of the blue I decided to try to order the newair inspite of what they was telling me. And guess what my order went thru I was shocked and happy at the same time. First thing I did was emailed the person I had been talking to and told them what happened all I got was excuses to I made a mistake to I talk to a lot of people every day and I got the product mixed up, mind you I talked to this person three days in a row and I was told the same thing. So I asked to speak to the manager what good that do he made up more excuses for them telling me that I was upset but I let it go, I was worried about my cigars the humidor came 10 days later because of the weekend I had to season it and get the humidity right for my cigars which was another 9 days by this time my cuban cigars was starting to dry out by the time I got them in the humidor I couldnt save them. So I called the customer service mgr he could care less he offered a 5% discount which was $13 I thought to myself that's crazy to make a long story shorter I ask for Mr Luke Peter's which is the CEO he told me Mr Peter's couldnt take my call right now so the next day I called and asked for Mr Peter's  and the lady said she would have him return my call. But as of today I still havent heard from Mr Peter's he is to good to talk to his customers. Today customer service offered 15% discount for a total of $25 for what they put me thru and what it cost me for the incorrect info that was given to me that cost me almost $300 in cigars that went bad. So you see Newair will no longer be my first choice and I will be returning the unit as soon as they send me a return label put yourself in my shoes do you think $25 is enough for the big costly wrong info given by the customer service rep. You make your own decision if you want to buy from here, but this could have easily been you it happened to and I still havent heard from the CEO Mr Peter's. If any thing change I believe in being fair I will put out another review telling you what changed if any thing because I feel you the customer deserve to know who you are trusting with your next purchase big or small.

Review.Titre: High Quality Service, Low Quality Product
Review.Contenu: There's no doubt that NewAir's customer service is helpful and responsive, almost aggressively so, which is fantastic! I've discussed that you're sure to receive good customer service when shopping under the NewAir umbrella.That being said, the longevity and build quality of their ice makers (in my case the now discontinued Luma Comfort 28) leaves a lot to be desired. I was perfectly happy with mine for about 5 months before the cubes started freezing into one big unbreakable chunk (I believe the problem is a broken sensor that handles the transition from ice creation to dispensing, as I can still do it manually). I was hoping to have it repaired but could not find an appliance shop that would have me and was only offered a replacement by NewAir after trashing mine (for $30 due to its refrigerant) and leaving a few reviews.You would think that posting nearly double the price of a comparibly sized competitors product would ensure a more resilient appliance, but instead you're paying for the year long warranty and speedy, relatively painless customer service as evidenced by the other 300+ NewAir Google reviews regarding their ice makers at the time of writing.I'd hate to create this much waste and hassle for such a minor problem, and maybe that's just the throw away world we live in, but doesn't change that it's abhorrent, especially when you expect a quality product and not just quality service.
While the service was great, the part in question should be available more readily

It was a frustrating experience. My mom requested a new heater due to the current one being burnt out after not being used much and was only about a year old. I helped her send the pictures and emails to get the replacement ordered. We sent the documentation and pictures by email  3 times before the order was finally placed and then the order was put in my name and not my moms 🙄😩 I don’t live with my mom and we gave her info over and over. If the order doesn’t get to her correctly neither of us will be very happy. There were too many people handling a simple return. It has been like pulling teeth trying to get the right information relayed in the correct format. Everyone was polite but just not very efficient with explaining what information was needed.Update - The new heater has been received. It was in my name not my moms per our many requests. No idea why it was put in my name as I wasn’t the one making the request but I was the one trying to help my mom get this taken care of. The time to fix these issues was when we were asked to send the same info and pictures over and over. Talking to Alai isn’t going to change the lack of consistency in getting the info in one place.
